snippet: Ending a climactic showdown in the final hours of the 112th Congress, the House sent to President Obama legislation to avert big income tax increases on most Americans.
abstract: House of Representatives, ending climactic fiscal showdown, passes and sends to Pres Obama legislation to avert big income tax increases on most Americans and prevent large cuts in spending for many government programs; Democrats hail compromise, which will allow income taxes to rise for first time in two decades, in this case for highest-earning Americans.

byline.contributor: Robert Pear and Peter Baker contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Ending a climactic showdown in the final hours of the 112th Congress, the House sent to President Obama legislation to avert big income tax increases on most Americans.

headline.main: Divided House Passes Tax Deal in End to Latest Fiscal Standoff
headline.print_headline: Under Pressure, House Approves Senate Tax Deal
